name: Boloti
movement: fast walk at 60 feet per turn
description: The Boloti is a Tiny fey creature known for its cunning and agility, capable of transforming between a true form and a vortex form.
memorable: Its ability to blend into aquatic environments and use a vortex form makes it a unique and challenging opponent.
goals: To ambush and outmaneuver opponents in aquatic terrains.
relations: Related to other fey creatures, potentially serving aquatic beings or elementals.
environment: Typically found in aquatic environments, particularly in or near bodies of water.
strengths: Excels in stealth and agility while underwater, can ambush effectively, and has access to helpful spells.
weaknesses: Disadvantaged on attack rolls when on dry land, vulnerable to being outmaneuvered on land.
attacks: Can strike with a dagger for piercing damage or use whirlpool to grapple and restrain targets.
most_powerful_ability: Water Mastery: Gains advantage on attack rolls when both it and its target are in the same body of water.
skills: Highly skilled in Stealth and proficient in Perception.
additional_information: Amphibious: Can breathe both air and water.
Water Camouflage: Advantage on Stealth checks while submerged.
Spellcasting: Can cast water-related spells, enhancing its aquatic capabilities.
Transformable: Can change between true and vortex forms.
Whirlpool ability: Grapples and restrains creatures within its space.
spellcasting: Can cast spells such as water breathing and control water to assist in aquatic navigation and battlefield control.
